clinical_study.brief_title: Monitoring of Lung Sounds of Patients With Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: Monitoring of Lung Sounds of Patients With Pneumonia

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Ministry of Work, Health and Social Affairs in North Rhine-Westph

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate if any correlation between lung sounds of pneumonia patients and the clinical development or therapy of the pneumonia exists.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: 3 times a day for longest 5 days

arm_group.description: Patient with pneumonia admitted to hospital will receive additional auscultation with lung sound analyzing stethoscope

intervention.description: Patients will be aucultated with lung sound analyzer. The auscultation will be done three times daily during the duration of the complete hospital stay.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ambulant aquired pneumonia with typically radiological signs
- hospitalisation at medical clinic I, university hospital Aachen
- age at least > 18 years
- CRB-65 score > 1
- CRP> 60mg/l
- fever
- lung sounds audible by stethoscope
- legal capacity and being able to understand and to follow the instructions of the study staff
- being able to consent and being able to understand the importance and the consequence of the study
- not being accomondated in an institution
Exclusion Criteria:
- pneumonia acquired in a hospital
- artificial respiration or other means for supporting respiration
- allergic reaction because of skin contact with polymers
- pregnancy or breast feeding
